name: Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Bethlehem

reviews.text: This hotel is close to both Lehigh & Lafayette colleges, it was a nice place to rest and relax during the college tour road trip.
reviews.title: Great for College Visits to Lehigh & Lafayette, Clean & Comfortable

likes.disliked: — No complaints, I was very satisfied and pleased. Would be nice if it had a beer/wine lounge.

reviews.text: Hotel is bright and clean, everything was fine. The 2 teens on our trip relaxed at the pool & hot tub while I napped, then we crossed the bridge to the town of Bethlehem for a nice dinner and strolled the quaint town.
reviews.title: Super Clean, Great Breakfast, and the Friendliest Staff Ever!

reviews.text: The hotel's free breakfast is adequate for your needs with a varied selection.
reviews.title: Very Clean, but.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The girls loved the flat screen TV in our room.
reviews.title: won't stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stopped on our way to NYC, went in and got a room for $94 for the night. Hotel is new and the rooms are beautiful and clean and big. Right off the interstate. Close to 2 fast food places, so we could still get food even late at night.
reviews.title: Clean and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First off, we were supposed to be booked for a King size bed and received 2 queens. This turned out to be a great thing because the mattresses were rock hard and my wife and I were both constantly tossing and turning all night, which kept us both awake the first night. I'm in the Army and have slept on some hard surfaces. I can say with confidence that these are the hardest mattresses I've ever slept on - I actually checked to see if someone had putt the box spring on top of the mattress. They also screwed up the number of days we had reserved. We arrived Wed night for a 3 night stay. By Friday afternoon, we were locked out of our room. Not a major deal to go get the card fixed, but the manager at the desk should have ensured that she had reprogrammed our cards at the same time that we had her check to see that we had 3 nights reserved.
reviews.title: Don't stay here if you have a bad back

likes.liked: — The breakfast was good minus the omelet

reviews.text: The room was clean, the flat screen TVs worked fine, the wireless internet was moderately fast, and a wall mounted digital thermostat has replaced the knobs on the HVAC.
reviews.title: Convenient to I 78

reviews.text: Newer HIExpress, very convenient to I-78 but with no highway noise. Rooms clean and comfortable. Had a slight problem which the staff rectified immediately. Would recomment this hotel to all.
reviews.title: Best Hotel EVER!!!

reviews.text: I stay at numerous hotels due to business and this particular hotel has exceeded my expectations. The staff is very friendly, caring and helpful. When I first checked in, I was on the side of the highway and it was very noisy.....the next morning I went to the front desk. Wilma said she'd be glad to switch me to a room on the other side of the hotel but it wouldn't be ready until later. She said she would have housekeeping move my things into the room for me. When I came back later that night, everything was as promised and my room was MUCH quiter.
reviews.title: After Wedding Distaster!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here because we wanted to use their shuttle to The Sands Casino. Everyone was friendly and helpful, the room was clean and comfy (microwave, coffee maker, refrig) and the complimentary breakfast was delicious! We will definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.text: I stayed here for four nights on a business trip and really enjoyed the place. The rooms are very clean, the hotel is quiet and they provide a good breakfast for free in the mornings. They even have chocolate chip cookies for you in the evenings. :D The staff is friendly and helpful and there are plenty of places to eat nearby. The Sands Casino is only a few miles away, so if you are visiting there, the Holiday Inn would convenient.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel appears very new and is in great condition. Front desk staff very friendly, gave good advice on place to eat. Room large and clean. HI definitely takes good care of Priority Club members - received goodie bag at check in with two bottles of water, chips, pretzels and granola bars. Yummy cinnamon rolls at breakfast, also sausage gravy.
reviews.title: New, Friendly, Clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay. We were able to park in the back and were near our room, but on Sunday, they blocked that entry way off, so we had to walk all around the hotel, or move our car. Otherwise, the breakfast staff tried hard to keep up with all the people eating breakfast, but the eggs were slow. I enjoyed the stay.
reviews.title: Very clean, nice staff.

reviews.text: My daughter and I stayed at the Holiday Inn Express while touring area colleges. I had stayed there previously while visiting my other daughter who attends Lehigh University. On both visits I was pleasantly surprised at how clean and well-kept the hotel is. The rooms are nicely sized and appointed with nice fresh linens and throws and none of those disgusting bedspreads and shams that so often adorn motel rooms. Service at the front desk was efficient and friendly. Even the complimentary breakfast was decent with a wide variety of items and good coffee available.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised, again!

aka: Holiday Inn Express Hotel And Suites Bethlehem
description: The Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Bethlehem, in the heart of beautiful Lehigh Valley, is conveniently located at exit 67 off Interstate 78, just minutes from historic downtown Bethlehem, and only 2 miles to the Sands Casino. We are the closest hotel to Saucon Valley Country Club, Silver Creek Country Club and The Meadows. Families will discover the Holiday Inn Express Bethlehem is the perfect choice for visits to Dorney Park & Wildwater Kingdom, the Crayola Factory, Musikfest, and Chriskindelmart. Business travelers will find us just 10 miles from Lehigh Valley Int'l Airport (ABE), and nearby to Olympus, Dunn & Bradstreet, Lutron, and Linde. The Holiday Inn Express Bethlehem is the closest hotel to Lehigh University's Goodman Stadium and Stabler Arena, just 1 mile away, and only 3 miles from Lehigh's main campus. Additionally, DeSales University, Lafayette College, Muhlenberg College, and Moravian College are all just minutes away.Enjoy comfortable, attractive rooms featuring free wireless Internet access, 32-inch flat screen TVs, microwaves, refrigerators, and free local phone calls. Start your day with our complimentary Express Start extended Continental breakfast featuring a variety of rotating items of bacon, sausage, scrambled eggs, cheese omelets, bagels, yogurt, and of course the world's best-tasting cinnamon rolls and our new pancakes.
